file_content.text: Containment system activated. We may begin.
The time for talk has passed, Jedi.
Captain Maddox. I've defeated Colonel Blight. Camp Sovereign's ready for you.
We'll get the rest of the prisoners under cover. Move fast!
Already here. We'll get to work right away.
Wide-range neural disruptors... would have mitigated Force sensitivity. Next time, perhaps.
I'm calling the Protectors. They'll patch your wounds and transport you into Republic custody.
It's time you faced justice.
You underestimate yourself, Master Jedi. I'm beyond their skills.
Next you'll be telling me the best way to get injured, or how to maximize my odds of survival.
Do you ever quit talking?
Don't get stabbed by a lightsaber. Ninety-seven percent lethal.
There won't be a next time. After what you've done to Bothawui, you don't deserve mercy.
Enough of that.
Too late for mercy now. The numbers will be... good.
We've got trouble, Master Jedi. Full squadron of Imp bombers headed our way.
No good. Flight trajectory has us surrounded. They're packing enough scatterblast to crater this camp.
We have to shoot these fighters down fast. Are the Seekers still online?
We need weapons.
Colonel Blight made a holocall before he died. He had this all planned.
Blight's last revenge.
I said I'd clear out the camp. It was your job to do the rest, remember?
You're all useless.
We'll work on our clairvoyance for next time.
We need to disable the bombers before they reach us. But I don't have time to rig anything.
Seeker firepower + approaching ships = vaporized Imperials
It's a shame the Seekers aren't online. Oh, wait, they are.
Wouldn't be ethical to recommend using the Seekers. Oops.
The Seekers. Accurate, lethal and poetic.
Blight has already provided. Use the Seekers.
Recommendation: The Seekers can be manually targeted at anything, master. Ignorant engineers, for example.
I'm sorry to interrupt, master, but the Seekers are still active. Perhaps they should be disabled, for safety's sake?
What about the... blast, what did Tav call them? The Seekers!
Looks like they've got a security lockout. Need to override that first. Control station's probably up by you, Master Jedi.
Look sharp and stay out of sight. I'll signal you once security's down.
Don't worry, I'll find it.
The Seeker operators are dead. Can Garith and his men take over?
Who will fire them?
We'll recruit some prisoners, too. They've seen 'em fired often enough.
I hope this mythical control station exists. We don't have a lot of time.
You'd better be right.
If I'm wrong, may an Imperial bomb squadron destroy us all.
Anyone who wants a shot at these scumbags, get in position!
I mean no offense, my lord. But consider: the psychological impact of losing five thousand civilians to one Jedi....
Your efficiency models do not interest me, Colonel. Remain where you are.
Perhaps if you showed Darth Legius my projections. Surely he would agree this is a waste of resources.
Enough. Your objective arrives. Show my master how efficient you can be.
You don't have to fight me. All I want is to free Camp Sovereign.
We can talk this out.
And provide a morale boost of up to one-hundred-and-fourteen percent. Unacceptable.
I've fought one Sith Lord already. Was that another I just saw?
Who's your friend?
Lord Zell. One of Darth Legius's apprentices. His only one, now.
One Imperial officer against a Jedi. That's not efficient--just stupid.
You have no chance.
Jedi = protectors of the galaxy // Colonel Blight = fool!
I'm beginning to think he just makes these up as he goes.
Meet the other thirteen. It's thirteen, right?
It's seventy-eight. Imperials.
On that much we agree.
Hostility: No master of mine can be called a fool, Imperial organic.
I am unable to verify the accuracy of these calculations, master.
You think this is a war of ideas, of principles--but it's all just numbers. Good ones mean victory. Bad ones... don't.
If that were true, the Republic would have stopped fighting long ago.
War is never that simple.
When the numbers are bad enough, you will.
You're about to risk your life for the Empire. Don't you feel anything?
Is that all you think about?
Annoyance, mostly.
This is for every Bothan you've killed, and every one you never got to.
You're a monster. [Attack]
There's time yet.
Everybody, back on board. We'll take off and draw them towards Republic territory.
We named him right. Bloodsucking son of a Hutt....
Now why didn't I think of that? These babies could bring down ten squadrons!
The Bothans are taking this much too personally.
The element of surprise allows a fifteen percent advantage. Unfamiliar surroundings may compensate.
Two-hundred-and-twenty-to-one, in your favor. I'm well aware of my odds, thank you.
One can't expect a Sith Lord to understand. Or a Jedi, for that matter. Eighty-seven percent fools, all of you.
